text: Kyphoscoliosis - Motor delay - Nemaline bodies - Neonatal hypotonia - Nonprogressive - Pes planus - Phenotypic variability - Skeletal muscle atrophy - Slow progression - Type 1 muscle fiber predominance - The Human Phenotype Ontology (HPO) has collected information on how often a sign or symptom occurs in a condition. Much of this information comes from Orphanet, a European rare disease database. The frequency of a sign or symptom is usually listed as a rough estimate of the percentage of patien
